formatted_case_content:
View printer friendly version
374 Phil. 103

SECOND DIVISION
SECOND DIVISION

[ G.R. No. 139281, September 29, 1999 ]
[ G.R. No. 139281, September 29, 1999 ]

SPOUSES ROMUALDO AND NORA SUAREZ, PETITIONERS, VS. ARSENIO SALAZAR, ET AL., RESPONDENTS.
R E S O L U T I O N
SPOUSES ROMUALDO AND NORA SUAREZ, PETITIONERS, VS. ARSENIO SALAZAR, ET AL., RESPONDENTS.

R E S O L U T I O N

Considering respondentâs âMotion to expunge All Pleadings Filed by Atty. Filemon A. Manangan with Motion to Hold Him in Contempt of Court and to Dismiss the Petitionâ and said Atty. Mananganâs admission at the hearing this morning, September 29, 1999, that he is not a lawyer entitled to practice law in the Philippines, and that he is the same âFilemon A. Mananganâ who was found by this Court G.R. No. 82760 (Filemon Manangan v. Court of First Instance of Nueva Viscaya, Branch 28) decided on August 30, 1990, to be in reality Andres Culanag who is not a member of the Philippine Bar, but despite these facts he has continued to misrepresent himself to be an attorney-at-law and has appeared as counsel for petitioners in this case, âAtty. Filemon A. Manangan, who is in reality Andres Culanag, is hereby declared guilty of indirect contempt of this Court. Wherefore, he is hereby sentenced to three (3) months imprisonment to be served at the Headquarters of the National Bureau of Investigation, Taft Avenue, Manila, until further orders from this Court.

SO ORDERED

Bellosillo, (Chairman), Mendoza, Quisumbing, and Buena, JJ., concur.
